results.title: Adorable Menteuse = Such an Adorable Liar
results.brief_description:
Juliette and Sophie share an apartment. Juliette is a garrulous 18-year-old girl who can’t go five minutes without telling a lie. She spies on her upstairs neighbour, a man of 40, pretending she is in love with him … until the day she really is. She vows to reform and speak nothing but the truth. But her reputation precedes her and her gentleman friend refuses to take anything she says seriously.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Michel Deville ; writers, Nina Companeez, Michel Deville ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Jean Dalve.
Cast: Marina Vlady, Macha Meril, Ginette Letondal, Jean-Marc Bory, Michel Vitold, Jean-Francois Calve, Claude Nicot, Michel Lonsdale, Christian Alers.

results.title: Adoption: children are waiting
results.creator_credit: Westminster Films, ONF | NFB, Lee Gordon and Laurie Jennings
results.brief_description: This film will inform and encourage prospective adopting parents and be helpful to professionals in the child-welfare field. In interviews, three couples relate their experiences of adopting older or handicapped children. A fourth couple explains how they, as foster parents, try to prepare children emotionally for adoption.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Westminster Films, ONF | NFB, Lee Gordon and Laurie Jennings

results.title: Adolescent development = Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College and Leslie Hill
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Adolescence is the period which occurs anywhere between 10 and 20 years of age, and during which we are trying to work out who we are. At this time we mature physically, sexually, socially, intellectually and morally, but not necessarily at the same rate, which is where some of the conflicts and embarrassments of adolescence occur. The peer group becomes of prime importance as it provides feedback on appropriate behaviour. This program takes a generally positive view of this period as an exciting challenge.

results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: DLGHS, GPN, George A. Colburn and Darrel Schwandt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.

group_works.title: Joe and Roxy

results.title: Adolescence: a case study
results.brief_description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.
results.description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.

results.title: Adolescence and learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Lawren Productions and Thomas G. Gregory
results.brief_description: Promotes general guidelines for understanding and helping the teenager with learning problems. Interviews professionals and specialists who deal with learning-disabled teenagers, and with the adolescents themselves.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: M K Productions, Philippe d'Argila and Daniel Riche
results.brief_description: A young girl takes ballet lessons with the Princess Troubetzkoy, a very old yet still famous ballerina. One day, she auditions for a ballet company, but another girl gets the job. So the girl goes back to the Princess to continue her studies. A sensitive study of an adolescent ballerina. With Sonia Petrovna and Madame Egorowa.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: It's About Time for SBS Television, Pat Hunder and Garry Dunstan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Not suitable for adults”.
A lighthearted exploration of the confusion and uncertainties surrounding adolescence through the eyes of 16 year olds from diverse backgrounds. Introduces the characters Tube, Gull, Curtis, Joey, Rosetta, Angela, Pepper and Gloria. Vignettes address “finding yourself, liking yourself and being your own person”, independence vs. limitations, the “real me”, friendships, peer group pressure and the physical/emotional changes occuring during the early teenage years. Similarly, the pressure of uncertain job prospects, school stresses, youthful dreams and concern for the world’s future.
